name: Sofitel Philippine Plaza Manila

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Listing this as a 5 star hotel and providing me with a 'Luxury Room' which barely meets the standard of a 3 star was not the only issue encountered at this hotel. Average wait time of 10 minutes at the front desk to be served, an even longer wait time for metered taxi's because of the hotel's location being so remote, being told that although i booked a Luxury Room that for me to get a new Luxury Room i need to pay double of what i actually paid otherwise i will be given an older room on a lower level floor, the room was horrific, thin walls so all could be heared from outside. Considering i could have stayed in Makati in a bigger/newer room and paid much less. cannot recommend this hotel for any reason.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed!

reviews.text: My mom stayed in this hotel for 5days and I gave her a visit. The pool area has a marvelous view because of the manila bay. But the interior is so plain, it has a countryside theme in colors and the balcony was made of wood so my daughter was so afraid to step on it. I think its unsafe too. They put the non complimentary items on the mini bar so if you are un aware, you might mistaken the evian water as complimentary just to know it cost 240pesos. The complimentary items are in the bathroom area which is i think not good that you would put a drinking water inside the bathroom.The room key card/ television malfuntioning which causes some inconvenience specially if you are here for business purposes as this will cause time hassles. The public transport is also not easily accesible so can't recommend if you are in a tight budget. The worst is that there is no broadband signal inside the room, which will push you to subscribe in their paid internet connection. But on the other hand, the staff we're the best part of it, they are friendly and accomodating, which embodies the Filipino hospitality.
reviews.title: No for the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights and found the service excellent. We were given a good room on level 8 overlooking the pool. The staff were very helpful and the travel agency attached to the hotel were excellent in arranging tours for us.
reviews.title: Good Location and Atmosphere
Good location in Manila
reviews.text: The food and drinks are on the expensive side for what you get.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very expensive for car hire. A hotel car uptown to the Mall of Asia is quoted at 300P but a taxi is available for 75p. We were quoted for a hotel car hire to the airport at 1500P but a taxi cost 130P. We didn't take advantage of the available upgrade package which is good value and I would purchase this upgrade in the future.
reviews.title: Ask at check-in

reviews.text: Great rooms, friendly & professional staff & amazing food!
reviews.title: WOW!
Nice place, but the pool area is a joke
reviews.text: Nice place, very expensive restaurant. Nice staff, great room. No problems except for the pool area. Looking at the pictures on the website, i saw myself sitting in a lounger next to the pool, sipping a mango shake, working on my suntan. Instead, we were surrounded by hundreds of screaming Filipino children and their parents taking pictures of said kids. They turned the entire pool into a public swimming pool, with a lifeguard blowing a whistle every 30 seconds and yelling at some disorderly kids. There was a wedding party going on, so while trying to ignore the screaming kids and relax, we had well-dressed members of the wedding party walking over us taking pictures, giving US dirty looks, as if WE didn't belong there! I booked the room for three nights, but after the first day we never went back to the pool, as it was constantly filled with screaming, splashing kids. They were also running around the entire grassy area, running into people. Sofitel even built a playground for them near the pool, for their enjoyment. Forget the people who pay top-dollar for a room, it seems they are more concerned with the children.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only spent 2 nights here and arrived late the first night due to a delayed flight. Hotel is very nice and we did feel out of place in the lobby with shorts and t-shirts on (but nobody said anything). The greeter at the front door was wearing a nice evening gown. The main restaurant is still under renovation from the earlier flood but we had to leave early in the morning to get to the Sun Cruise dock for a day trip to Corregidor island. It was great as the hotel is so close you can walk to the pier in 5 minutes. That night we took the hotel shuttle to the Mall of Asia but had to take a taxi back since the shuttle stopped at 8pm (taxis are cheap in Manila compare to NY). We had hoped to go enjoy the pool but there was lightning so they closed the pool. We'll have to use it on our next visit as it looked awesome.
reviews.title: Nice stay - no problems other than weather

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nice and modern and very comfortable. Absolutely no complaints at all (other than the weather). Everyone was very helpful. We took a car to the airport and it was 600 PHP (paid to the person at the hotel).
reviews.title: wonderful service

reviews.text: We're having a great time here! The placeis perfect for a romantic escape.
reviews.title: First night out with our daughter

reviews.text: Staff speak great English, and the level of service and safety is very high.
reviews.title: Well run hotel!!

description: Sofitel Philippine Plaza Manila Hotel is a unique 5 star luxury hotel in Manila with a resort setting close to Mall of Asia, Manila Ocean Park, Intramuros, US Embassy, PICC and major tourist spots in the Philippines. Sofitel 5-star accommodation includes 609 rooms and suites boasting of balconies and spectacular views of world famous Manila Bay sunsets.
